segments.text: I notice the little boy stretching to reach the cookie jar, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s balancing on it like it’s nothing, but it’s clearly unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, waiting for a cookie, and she doesn’t seem to care about the danger either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t fall and hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, but she’s too busy with her dishes to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this; it’s making me too anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to stop him before he gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to look away, but I can’t.
segments.speaker: PAR
